Raw Material Extraction.description: This process involves extracting raw materials necessary for manufacturing components of Xiaomi Mi 11, such as metals for electronics, glass, and plastics.
Raw Material Extraction.rationale: Raw materials are essential to creating the components of the smartphone.

Component Manufacturing.description: This includes the production of intermediate materials and the fabrication of components like the AMOLED display and Snapdragon chipset.
Component Manufacturing.rationale: Components need to be manufactured before assembly into the final product.

Eco-Friendly Packaging Production.description: Production of packaging with reduced environmental impact, avoiding plastic wraps.
Eco-Friendly Packaging Production.rationale: Sustainable packaging is part of the product's life cycle.

Transport of Raw Materials.description: Transportation of raw materials from extraction sites to manufacturing facilities.
Transport of Raw Materials.rationale: Logistics are required to move materials to where they are processed.

Transport of Components.description: Shipping of various components and materials to the final assembly plant.
Transport of Components.rationale: Components need to be assembled at a central location.

Final Assembly.description: Assembling parts into the final Xiaomi Mi 11 product.
Final Assembly.rationale: The final assembly is necessary to create a market-ready product.

Quality Control.description: Ensuring all products meet Xiaomi's quality standards before distribution.
Quality Control.rationale: Quality control ensures product reliability and customer satisfaction.

Distribution to Warehouses.description: Moving finished products from the factory to distribution warehouses.
Distribution to Warehouses.rationale: Warehousing facilitates product readiness for market distribution.

Retail Distribution.description: Distribution from warehouses to retail stores and online platforms.
Retail Distribution.rationale: Retail distribution connects the product to consumers.

Customer Setup.description: Activities associated with customer unboxing and setup of the device.
Customer Setup.rationale: The setup is part of the user experience and product adoption.

Device Usage.description: Operation of Xiaomi Mi 11 by the end user, including its connectivity and applications.
Device Usage.rationale: Use phase is integral for understanding the product lifecycle.

Software Updates.description: Provision of software updates for security and performance enhancements.
Software Updates.rationale: Maintenance through updates is essential for product longevity.

Screen Repair.description: Repair process for cracked screens or other damages.
Screen Repair.rationale: Repairs extend the lifespan of the product.

Battery Replacement.description: Replacing old or degraded batteries to ensure continued device performance.
Battery Replacement.rationale: Batteries are wear components that need eventual replacement.

Device Refurbishment.description: Refurbishing devices for resale or redistribution.
Device Refurbishment.rationale: Refurbishment can bring the device back to a usable condition.

Energy Consumption.description: Energy used during device operation, including battery charging.
Energy Consumption.rationale: Energy consumption impacts the ecological footprint during use.

N/A.rationale: The Xiaomi Mi 11 does not require water during usage.

Product Decommission.description: Activities related to taking the device out of service.
Product Decommission.rationale: Important for transition to end-of-life phase.

Transport to Recycling.description: Transporting the decommissioned product to recycling centers.
Transport to Recycling.rationale: Efficient waste management of the product is critical.

Electronic Waste Processing.description: Processing and recovery of components and materials from the product.

Final Disposal.description: Disposal of non-recyclable elements and materials from the product.
Final Disposal.rationale: Responsible disposal is necessary for environmental management.
